title: Gauff calls for more player privacy after racquet smash
summary: Coco Gauff calls for more privacy for players after she was filmed smashing a racquet after a devastating defeat by Elina Svitolina in the Australian Open quarter-finals.

title: What's behind the Irish impact in the NFL?
summary: BBC Sport NI looks at the growing Irish impact in the NFL and the next batch of players hoping to secure a career in American football.

title: Man Utd's Dorgu set for weeks out with hamstring issue
summary: In-form Patrick Dorgu is still being assessed but he is likely to miss Manchester United matches with the injury he picked up against Arsenal.

title: Luiz open to Villa return as Emery reignites interest
summary: Aston Villa make a fresh enquiry to re-sign former midfielder Douglas Luiz on loan as Unai Emery looks to bolster his options in the centre of the pitch.

title: First Hundred auction to span two days in March
summary: The Hundred's inaugural player auction will be held in London on 11 and 12 March, in a historic first for major sport in the UK.

title: Brighton women's coach Rado Vidosic dies aged 64
summary: Rado Vidosic, Brighton's women's and girls' head of coaching and father of women's head coach Dario, dies aged 64.

title: Wales call Wainwright as Assiratti to miss Six Nations
summary: Wales prop Keiron Assiratti is set to miss the Six Nations after suffering a calf injury with fellow Cardiff prop Sam Wainwright called into the squad.

title: Assiratti to miss Six Nations as Wales call in Wainwright
summary: Wales prop Keiron Assiratti is set to miss the Six Nations after suffering a calf injury with fellow Cardiff prop Sam Wainwright called into the squad.

title: Lions tour provides spark for Jones after World Cup peak
summary: England centre Meg Jones targets the first women's Lions tour in 2027 and back-to-back World Cups in 2029 as she sets new rugby goals.

title: Carrick needs to judged over a longer period - Sutton
summary: Mark Chapman is joined by Chris Sutton on The Monday Night Club as the former Premier League striker praises Michael Carrick after his "brilliant start" as interim head coach of Manchester United.

title: Palace could get dragged into this - Sutton
summary: Chris Sutton tells the Monday Night Club that he believes Crystal Palace could be dragged into a relegation battle in the Premier League if they don't make a decision on manager Oliver Glasner soon.

title: Briton Hennessy to headline on BBC Two
summary: Francesca Hennessyworld-title eliminator against Ellie Bouttell will headline at London's Copper Box Arena on Saturday, live on BBC Two and BBC iPlayer.

title: Wales to face Barbarians in Twickenham double-header in June
summary: Wales men and women will face the Barbarians in a double-header at Allianz Stadium in Twickenham in June.

title: Forest make ยฃ35m Mateta bid - Tuesday's gossip
summary: Nottingham Forest make a ยฃ35m bid for Crystal Palace's Jean-Philippe Mateta, Juventus consider move for Everton's Beto, Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes will decide on his future at the end of the season, plus more.

title: The African champions facing Arsenal after a football revolution
summary: Moroccan champions AS FAR have been building towards their moment in Fifa's Champions Cup against Arsenal on Wednesday.

title: Injuries, Everton & overseas friendly - Scotland's World Cup preparations
summary: BBC Scotland looks at the national team's warm-up schedule, Steve Clarke's injury concerns, and what sort of shape his side's opponents are in.

title: Doncic's scoring streak continues as Lakers beat Bulls
summary: Luka Doncic keeps up his scoring streak with 46 points against the Chicago Bulls to become the quickest Los Angeles Lakers player to reach 2,000 NBA points.

title: Zverev thanks serve after 24 aces help him beat Tien
summary: Third seed Alexander Zverev thanks his serve for pulling him past an "unbelievable" Learner Tien to reach the Australian Open semi-finals.

title: 'It left a sour taste' - Ireland target fast Six Nations start
summary: Captain Caelan Doris says Ireland are determined to atone for a disappointing end to last year's Six Nations, starting with next week's tournament opener against holders France.

title: Melbourne hits 42C amid Australian Open heat warning
summary: Extreme heat impacts the Australian Open again on Tuesday, with the tournament reaching its maximum "heat stress" rating.

title: How to Secure Tickets to Super Bowl LX & Bad Bunnyโs HalftimeยShow
summary: The Seattle Seahawks vs. New England Patriots Super Bowl matchup kicks off on Feb. 8.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Super Bowl LX is finally set. After a thrilling NFL postseason, the Seattle Seahawks and the New England Patriots are headed to Santa Clara to competed for the coveted Vince Lombardi Trophy. Bad Bunny will also be joining both football squads at Levi’s Stadium for a can’t-miss halftime show . How to Buy Super Bowl 2026 Tickets Online, At a Glance: Date: Feb. 8, 2026 Location: Levi’s Stadium, Santa Clara Best Ticket Sites: StubHub , Vivid Seats , SeatGeek , TicketNetwork , Ticketmaster , Gametime No strangers to the Super Bowl, the Patriots make their return since the Tom Brady and Bill Belichick era win in 2018. Led by sophomore quarterback Drake Maye and head coach Mike Vrabel, who also won a ring as a Patriots player, this will be New Englands 12th Super Bowl appearance and potentially the franchises seventh Lombardi trophy. On the flip side, the Seahawks only have one Super Bowl win, which came in 2014. A year later, Seattle facโฆ

title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
summary: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

title: Barclay latest British athlete to join Enhanced Games
summary: Swimmer Emily Barclay becomes the third British athlete to join the controversial Enhanced Games, set to take place in May.

title: Moyes praises Everton's 'much better' second half
summary: Everton manager David Moyes praises a "much better" second-half display that saw French forward Thierno Barry equalise to give the Toffees a 1-1 Premier League draw with Leeds at the Hill Dickinson stadium.

title: Leeds have good momentum right now - Farke
summary: Leeds United manager Daniel Farke believes his side's 1-1 draw at Everton is another "good result" and another example of their improved form, having lost only once in the past 11 matches.

title: Barry goal rescues draw for Everton against Leeds
summary: Watch Premier League highlights as Everton's Thierno Barry continues his good run of form with a second-half goal to earn the Toffees a 1-1 draw with Leeds United.

title: England lock Ward pregnant with second child
summary: England World Cup winner Abbie Ward announces she is pregnant with her second child.

title: Bayern Munich open talks to extend Kane contract
summary: Bayern Munich sporting director Max Eberl says the German club are in talks with Harry Kane about extending the striker's contract.

title: New F1 cars 'look really cool' - Russell
summary: McLaren and Red Bull release images of their 2026 Formula 1 cars as pre-season testing begins in Spain.

title: England captain Sciver-Brunt hammers first-ever WPL century
summary: Nat Sciver-Brunt makes history with an unbeaten hundred for Mumbai Indians against Royal Challengers Bengaluru, the first century in Women's Premier League history.

title: No sponsor, kit on order & visa wait - Scotland embrace late World Cup call
summary: Scotland are "confident" visa issues will not prevent them arriving late for the men's T20 World Cup as chief executive Trudy Lindblade tells BBC Stumped about their "unique" preparations after a late call to the tournament.

title: One week until transfer deadline day - who could be on the move?
summary: BBC Sport looks at some of the players that have been linked with moves before the Premier League transfer deadline on 2 February at 19:00 GMT.

title: Greater belief inspiring British progress - Cairess
summary: Emile Cairess says British athletes now have the "belief" that they can compete with the world's best before he targets Mohamed Farah's national record at the 2026 London Marathon.

title: 'Football doesn't need to take lives' - McQueen daughters on inquest
summary: Repeatedly heading footballs is "likely" to have contributed to the brain disease which was a factor in the death of former Scotland and Manchester United footballer Gordon McQueen, an inquest found. His daughters spoke after the verdict.

title: Pakistan set deadline for T20 World Cup boycott decision
summary: A decision on whether Pakistan will boycott next month's men's T20 World Cup is set to be made by early next week.

title: Can unfancied Scots be Six Nations contenders?
summary: Captain Sione Tuipulotu says Scotland must believe they can win the 2026 Six Nations, despite low expectations following a difficult autumn.

title: 'It's unfathomable' - Dyche wants towels banned for throw-ins
summary: Nottingham Forest boss Sean Dyche wants the Premier League to ban towels from the sidelines after complaining about the time taken for throw-ins during his side's win at Brentford.

title: Besiktas pay ยฃ11m for Abraham - to sell him to Villa
summary: Besiktas pay ยฃ11.2m to Roma for Tammy Abraham - as the Turkish club prepare to sell him to Aston Villa.

title: Former Wales boss Yorath remembered at funeral as 'funny, humble man'
summary: About 100 mourners attended the funeral of the Wales and Leeds midfielder, who died aged 75.

title: What history tells us about Arsenal's title chances
summary: With Arsenal still four points clear despite a wobble, how confident can they be of winning the title based on Premier League precedent?

summary: The Seattle Seahawks beat the Los Angeles Rams 31-27 in a thrilling NFC Championship match to set up a rerun of the 2015 Super Bowl against the New England Patriots.

title: Bradman baggy green cap sets record fee at auction
summary: A 'Baggy Green' cap worn by Don Bradman during a series against India in 1947-48 is been sold for A$460,000 (ยฃ232,000) at auction.

title: Fulham close to agreement for Man City winger Bobb
summary: Fulham are close to reaching an agreement to sign winger Oscar Bobb from fellow Premier League side Manchester City.

title: 'Heading football likely to have contributed to McQueen's brain disease'
summary: An inquest concludes that "it is likely that repetitive head impacts, sustained by heading the ball while playing football, contributed to the CTE" which was a factor in the former Scotland footballer's death.

summary: MOTD pundit Danny Murphy explains how Manchester United earned their impressive win at Premier League leaders Arsenal, and how he feels the Gunners will react.

summary: Arsenal's winless run may normally be cause for concern - but the stats suggest they are still in control of the Premier League title race.

title: Why can't Newcastle win without Guimaraes?
summary: Newcastle United have yet to win a league game without Bruno Guimaraes since he made his debut for the club in 2022.

summary: Estevao Willian replaces the injured Cole Palmer to inspire Chelsea to a comfortable win over Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park.

summary: Tennis is seen as a rich sport. But many stars, including Novak Djokovic and Elina Svitolina, have forged successful careers from humble beginnings.
